pt.ulisboa.tecnico.cycleourcity.scout.mobilesensing

Class MobileSensingPipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ulisboa.tecnico.cycleourcity.scout.mobilesensing.MobileSensingPipeline

  • public class MobileSensingPipeline
extends java.lang.Object
    The MobileSensingPipeline is one of Scout's core components. It is responsible for connecting the sensor captured data and the respective sensor pre-processing pipelines.
    The MobileSensingPipeline is designed as a singleton entity, meaning that at each moment there is only one instance of the pipeline running, which is accessible to any Scout component.
    This component is designed to run at a fixed rate, every few seconds, once a sensing session has been initiated. At each iteration the MobileSensingPipeline dispatches all enqueue sensor samples to a sensor specific pipeline responsible for processing those sample, and that runs asynchronously.
    The MobileSensingPipeline also serves as a bridge between the application and the StorageManager.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int WINDOW_SIZE
      Specifies the rate at which the MobileSensingPipeline sensing session should run, that is, every WINDOW_SIZE seconds.

        public void pushSensorSample(edu.mit.media.funf.json.IJsonObject sensorConfig,

        Adds a new sensor data sample to the pre-processing queue.
        Parameters:
        sensorConfig - The sensor configuration
        sensorSample - The sensor data sample
        Throws:
        pt.ulisboa.tecnico.cycleourcity.scout.mobilesensing.exception.MobileSensingException - if the sensor type, specified by the sensorConfig parameter is not supported.

      • archiveData

        public void archiveData(java.lang.String tag)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        pt.ulisboa.tecnico.cycleourcity.scout.storage.exceptions.NothingToArchiveException
        Given all the sensor data captured during the last sensing session, this method procedes to storing persistently that information.
        The information is stored in two ways:
        • As a GPX file, which can be used to preview the traveled track.
        • As a DataBase file, which contains the information gathered by all running supported sensors.
        Parameters:
        tag - The prefix given to the file
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - should the ScoutStorageManager be unable to store the data.
        pt.ulisboa.tecnico.cycleourcity.scout.storage.exceptions.NothingToArchiveException - should there be no information to store.
        See Also:
        StorageManager
